author: bridge-bot
content:
<fradamt> Wrote this document with Luca and Roberto to discuss some of the fork-choice related challenges of DAS: https://notes.ethereum.org/@fradamt/das-fork-choice
In particular, the first attack (a stronger ex-ante reorg) shows the need for a sufficiently high custody if we use the trailing fork-choice, while the second attack relies on being able to trick proposers into thinking that unavailable blocks are available, and is quite annoying because it doesn't require controlling a lot of stake. 
We discuss using the (block, slot) fork-choice to improve things and talk about a concrete spec modification, including a backoff scheme, but ultimately this still does not completely eliminates the problems, just makes the attacks more difficult
